website_summaries.verdict: The dual-height design makes this step stool a win-win for toddlers and preschoolers.
pros: Lightweight, yet holds up to 150 pounds
Toddlers use both steps to reach toilet or sink
Measures 10.3 inches high by 12.7 inches wide by 14 inches deep
Slip-resistant design provides secure surface on all floor styles
Soft-grip steps give little feet comfort and support
cons: Anti-slide pieces are small, so consider combining with a non-skid mat

customer_reviews.title: Nice but buy the Cusfull version instead
customer_reviews.text: There is a proliferation of these two-step stools on Amazon. They are not all the same. This is EXACTLY the same as the highly rated Cusfull stool which is slightly cheaper and doesn't have an unattractive logo on front. The gray is more of a medium gray on the other where this is a lighter greige, but the silicone non slip surface is almost identical and the clear non slip pads on the bottom are identical. I would only this one if color matters to you and logos don't. I would not recommend the Be-moming stool on the other hand, which has a slippery plastic 'non-slip' surface and rubber feet that fall out.
customer_reviews.author: dvb

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids, and short people.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to wash her hands and eventually for the toilet. It hasn't slipped despite it being on tile. Great product worth the price. As a added bonus my wife uses it for reaching stuff in the upper cabinets when I'm not around.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed K.

customer_reviews.title: A major problem-solver
customer_reviews.text: A great success. My two-year-old granddaughter has put it to use immediately, using it in her bedroom to help climb into her new bed, her first, and then moving it herself to the bathroom so she can climb up to the sink. Just perfect -- sturdy, light, and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret King

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product with NO stickers
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. Came without any "impossible to remove" stickers that was an additional bonus. But most importantly, this Step Stool has a perfect height for my 3 year old! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Oleksandr P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for potty training. My 2.5 year old son can climb onto the potty by himself and can move it over to the sink and brush his teeth on this step stool. Non-slip grip actually works. I had a wooden step stool before, but was afraid that he was going to crack the toilet seat when he smacked it up against the toilet to start climbing on it, so this one is perfect. It's super light and even has handles on both sides, so he can move it around by himself. Will purchase another one for one of our other bathrooms as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my son who is learning to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who is learning to use the potty. The top step is not long enough for him to turn around. Today he fell off. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: sskd

customer_reviews.title: Best stool on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stool, I think it's the best one on the market. My daughter has been using it for the last year or so and it works really well. I like the two steps up, the handles on the edges to move it (my 2 yr old could move it) and I also like that it stays where it's at when she is on it. Just watch out for your toes when your kid is throwing this thing around :}
customer_reviews.author: drfroglegs87

customer_reviews.title: top is too narrow
customer_reviews.text: My 21m old has fallen off this stool sooo many times while brushing teeth/messing around at the bathroom sink. The top should be wider and should probably also have a ridge or some other way to signify being near the edge. I can't imagine how a child could use this for climbing onto the toilet - how could she safely turn around? The stool is sturdy and doesn't slip, but it isn't the right choice for a young toddler who doesn't know how to be "careful" yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah LaRose

customer_reviews.title: Toddler essential for potty training and teaching boys young to wash their hands!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great step. Decent quality. I like the anti slip features. Great for my little guy to reach the sink and to help him squat on the larger toilet. Although we use this on our shorter/smaller toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and very Secure
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and very Secure. Our grandson felt safe and secure. The product also has slip grids and we as grandparents felt very comfortable for using as we teach him for washing, brushing teeth and grooming. He is 2 and loves being able to do things on his own. Also for his step up to commode. Thank you. * we will be ordering another for his parents. We highly recommend this product and company for their excellent service!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Short, no more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step stool because I’m am only 5’2”...but I also weigh 112lbs so I thought I would try it because I have difficulty reaching the kitchen cabinet where I keep containers. So not only is it the perfect height I needed but easily supported my weight. VERY STURDY!!! No bowing, no cracking, no tipping. I ordered two more, for the laundry room and outside wherever I was struggling for height. Now no need to drag out the big step ladders every time I needed to do something. A child would have no problems with this item barring horseplay. Glad I took a chance and ordered!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaweb

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe and unsturdy.  Don't put your little ones i harms way
customer_reviews.text: I would have given them zero stars if that was an option! The first step is not wide enough. My grandsons foot hangs off the edge and if he stands with both feet hanging off the first step the back of the stool lifts off the ground. It's an accident waiting to happen. My grandson is not a big kid he only weighs 37 lbs. This is NOT a sturdy stool! Very unhappy with this product. It is not safe for little ones. I want my money back but the company wants me to pay return shipping when they are selling an unsafe item. Would not recommend dealing with this company!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Schiedler

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow and tippy
customer_reviews.text: It's too narrow. My toddler is afraid to use it without me holding his hand, which defeats the purpose of a step stool to use the toilet. Perhaps he will get over it and will use it later, but right now, it's just a tripping hazard in the bathroom. I'd prefer a wider base and smaller steps, as its quite unstable the way its built.
customer_reviews.author: KittytoTigerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for reaching high places
customer_reviews.text: Does not slip on our bathroom floor. It's light so my 3 year old can easily lift this up and move it to where he needs it. Very sturdy. However, I find that there's not enough surface area on the steps for my toddler to safely/comfortably turn around on his feet. Not a huge issue but you might need to supervise your kid to until he/she is used to it. I wouldn't want the stool to be any bigger anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great stepstool for little ones to reach the sink
customer_reviews.text: We used this so my 2 year old can reach the sink to wash her hands after using the potty. Before we got this we were just lifting her up to the sink, which was uncomfortable for both her and us, so this stepstool definitely does the trick (and gives her the independence to wash her hands on her own, which she loves.) I was initially worried it would take up too much space but it really isn't bad, fits in well even though our bathroom is small.
customer_reviews.author: andrew crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good stool, maybe too short.
customer_reviews.text: The stools are very sturdy and durable. The stated heights are correct, but it is a little too short for my 2+ year old. If it were 3-4" higher it would be perfect for the sink. Not potty training yet, but likely a good height for that purpose. It is a bit narrow as well. Good stool, just verify that the size is appropriate for your child.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Utke

customer_reviews.title: Great stool for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Love the step stool, the top is not wide enough for my 3 year old to turn around on to sit on the big potty, but its a hit in our house as in its her stool she can pick it up, its not heavy to transport where ever she chooses. As all parents are aware at the age 3 they want to do everything ny themselves turn on the light, get the water ready for there teeth etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Accomplice For Mischievous Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Got these so that our toddler could wash her hands on her own after pottying. They're perfect for helping her reach a standard size sink. Very light and easy for her to move. Actually... too easy. Now she gets into everything. She wants crackers? Moves the step stool to the pantry and helps herself. And no more setting stuff on the breakfast bar because she can reach it now with the help of this step stool. All in all, these do the job a bit too well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3.5 yo
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old uses these to reach the bathroom sink and they are perfect for him. They are sturdy and we haven’t had any issues with them. We do have them placed on a rug so slipping has not been an issue. My 2 year old daughter still can’t use these yet but she is small for her age.
customer_reviews.author: SoonToBeMomof3

customer_reviews.title: The step is too narrow!!
customer_reviews.text: The product seems pretty sturdy but it’s too narrow. Got it for my son to use the adult toilets. My son almost fell off multiple times bc there’s not enough space for him to turn around so he can sit on the toilet. Had to get a much wider step stool from ikea.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: They work better on a mat that does not slide
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these at every sink for my toddler to wash her hands. They work well for that purpose. They work better on a mat that does not slide, as the anti-slide pieces are very small. I have not had a problem on tile that is not completely smooth though. This step stool is light enough that my 18 pound child can carry it around the house. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: slt165

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect, we had a step stool but it was only one step and it was fine for washing hands but my 2 year old uses this to get on and off the potty and it allows his fit to be on the top step while sitting on the potty. I like it so much I'm buying one for every bathroom and possibly even one for grandma's house, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Sticks well to the floor
customer_reviews.text: My favorite feature I was not expecting about this step stool is the fact the back of it isn't a solid piece. Due to this, the step stool is easily set in front of the potty without being any distance away from the potty. This makes it slide less when a toddler is getting on and off the potty. It's also great as a general step stool for sink use, watching mom cook, etc. Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Kaiea

customer_reviews.title: Nice color well made stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy step stool with nice non slip grip. It is a nice grey color which matches our bathroom perfectly. We don't like to have a bunch of bright colored kids stuff laying around. My daughter loves this stool. Her feet don't quite reach it on the potty yet but she's only 20 months and we have a higher toilet. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa

customer_reviews.title: I liked this tool so much the first time that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this tool so much the first time that I ordered it that I ordered it again for another bathroom. The stool was cracked in half when I open the box. So I returned it and ordered it again and yet again I open the box a second time around and the stool is cracked in half. I returned both stools and will not be ordering from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Maria D.

customer_reviews.title: ... and getting up to the sink and am very disappointed. The stool has no weight and the rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stool to help my 2 year old with potty training and getting up to the sink and am very disappointed. The stool has no weight and the rubber on the legs doesn’t provide enough traction that the stool moves which is unsafe. The stool is not wide enough as my toddler almost always misses the step and falls when coming down. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CK W

customer_reviews.title: A few necessary extra inches
customer_reviews.text: She can reach the sink, yay!!! I got this step stool to help me two year old reach the sink after using the potty- she could not reach with other step stools but this worked! I appreciate the value that came with the two pack.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This stool is fantastic! The height is perfect for my 2-year-old. I love the non-slip grips on the bottom so it won't move across the floor, and the ones on top of the steps so she won't slip and fall. It is light-weight and my daughter likes to move it to the sink and the toilet... and basically anywhere. Easy to clean and doesn't take up too much space. It really is great.
customer_reviews.author: dwilliams89

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect size for my two year old to utilize the toilet and then pick up and utilize to wash her hands in the sink. Great traction on steps even for slippery shoes. Only down side is it would be nice to have the same rubber on the steps, to be put on the stool traction part on the bottom. The stool does slip slightly, but overall great product and still worth 5!
customer_reviews.author: Coolguyfo

customer_reviews.title: Great step stool for a toddler growing in independence
customer_reviews.text: We initially bought this for my 20 month toddler to use to wash his hands and brush his teeth. We had to buy another one because he loves to carry it around the house to get a better view. He uses it to look out of the window and watch us cook in the kitchen. Nice neutral color lets it blend in with the rest of the house and the kid likes it just as much as the colorful ones we see at some of our friends' houses.
customer_reviews.author: StephRC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome step stool
customer_reviews.text: Love this step stool!! It is the perfect height for our 3 year old for both the potty and the sink. It was tall enough where her feet are flat for sitting on the potty (which she needs). It’s sturdy and has rubber grips on the steps so she won’t slip off. She loves her stools!
customer_reviews.author: Liz H

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 of these stools now. My daughter couldn’t be more delighted that she can now reach things in the pantry and bathroom, the light switch in the playroom, and the forth is a rover- she takes it anywhere she needs it. Hasn’t slipped yet and isn’t too tall where she is uncomfortable stepping up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: My 2 yr old loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter because it was time to potty train. and she needed to learn to reach the sink to wash her hands. I've been super happy with this stool because it is very sturdy, my two year old can carry it around to different places. And it makes her feel more independent. I really like that it comes in a neutral color because I'm not a huge fan of bright vibrant colors. I believe this will last well into our next child.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ashcraft

customer_reviews.title: My daughter LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to be able to reach the sink, potty etc. I unboxed it and told my daughter this was her step stool. Her face was priceless! She is now carrying it around the entire house saying “my step stool” she loves it and it grips to the floor extremely well and the grips on the steps work great!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Great potty training stool!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for toddler potty training! Tall enough for our standard toilet and our standard two year old. :) She loves the independence her stool brings, and she lugs it around everywhere to get a better view of what the adults are doing, and even brings it to the bathroom to wash her own hands when she wants. This also holds my weight (150lbs) when I need to reach something on top of the fridge, etc.
customer_reviews.author: slashfemme

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy for kids move it and works!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy this step stool!!! My 2 year old loves to go to the Beth room since we got this stool. Saving quite a bit on diapers. I wish staps wold be wider but I still would recommend as is too.
customer_reviews.author: nataliya

customer_reviews.title: Tall & stable
customer_reviews.text: More stable than other stools we've tried, and these help our toddler actually reach the sink! They're a little too tall to use in front of the toilet, but are great for hand washing at the sink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is SSSS Same Size Stepping Stool
customer_reviews.text: I do like the stepping stool but it came in a same size for both, I thought it would have come in two different size just like what posted in the pictures. I was plans to have one for the sink and one for potty training, but it too tall for his toilet. I still like it anyway and I think is still useful. I think is fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Good stool
customer_reviews.text: It is a stool and their isn't much to say. I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 because their was an odd sticker on the front that wasn't advertised in the pictures of the products. My daughter has been enjoying the stools and they are light enough for her to move around and use.
customer_reviews.author: Alli B

customer_reviews.title: toddler uses this for EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.text: So versatile ! Bought this as a step stool to help my toddler potty independently. However, he likes it so much he uses it all over the house! From the kitchen to his bedroom . Wish I had this in my house sooner
customer_reviews.author: Mia & AJ

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is light and it has two steps. My daughter has been able to carry this herself (she's only 2.5 years old) so she can independently use it for the toilet and the sink (our sinks sit a little higher than my families houses). Really pleased with the product
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great stool—bought two more
customer_reviews.text: Durable, nonslip, and a perfect height for our preschooler who is potty training and learning to wash hands, brush his teeth at the sink, etc. I bought two other stools that were less expensive but did not do the job, so I went back to buying two more of this dual height stool. Now there’s one for each bathroom that my son uses as well as the kitchen sink.
customer_reviews.author: Ptoy

customer_reviews.title: For Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My toddler was constantly wanting to wash her own hands by herself when she got them dirty so I bought this and it pretty much does the job. It's perfect probably for your bathroom sink. Not good for kitchen sink unless your kid is taller than a 3yr old.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Olinger

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stool for my grandsons to use in the bathroom when they're at my house. It's sturdy but lightweight and doesn't slide when stepped on so far. It works well for my young toddlers. The stool I purchased is white/gray as pictured unlike other reviewers who complained they received a different color stool.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old uses this to brush her teeth at the bathroom sink. She loves being independent and this really helps her. Sometimes she’ll play using it as a platform for her toys.
customer_reviews.author: โบวี่

customer_reviews.title: Light grey
customer_reviews.text: This item is perfect for our two toddlers. Each is able to use the toilet and sink by themselves. It is light enough that they can move it, solid enough that it doesn't collapse, and it is slip-resistant on both bottom and top. I was happy that the top was covered and not just spots like other slip-resistant step stools.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great step stool
customer_reviews.text: This step stool has made it so much easier for my granddaughter to reach counters, sinks, and to watch us cook. I like that I can even use it if needed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect height and size for my toddler. It's sturdy and has handles on the sides to carry the stool easily. I would highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Great and sturdy step stool for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Great step stool for my 2 year old so he can wash his hands and brush his teeth at the bathroom sink "like a big boy". We dont use it for potty training so unsure if its suitable (I'm sure its fine)
customer_reviews.author: Courtney F.

customer_reviews.title: Non obtrusive, utilitarian
customer_reviews.text: This stool helps my 36-incher wash her hands at the sink. We originally purchased one without the extra step, but it was not tall enough. This stool is still easy to tuck away and is not obnoxiously colored.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it’s clean.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrive used and dirty. Unacceptable. I won’t return because I can clean it easier than returning it. But hello we are in the middle of a pandemic... can I get CLEAN products especially clean that don’t specify they have been USED. Thanks for making me go full Karen on a review.
customer_reviews.author: Joleen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stairs for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy steps for little ones to get up a little higher. We use these for potty training our little gal. It’s light enough that she can move it from the toilet to the sink to wash her hands. There are no slip pads on the four corners of the steps to help it stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great for Toddler
customer_reviews.text: We loved this stool so much that we ended up buying 3 so we had one in each of our bathrooms. They are easy to clean and easy for my two year old to climb up on without slipping. They have been a huge help with him learning to brush his teeth, wash his hands and get on the potty. I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: We bought 2 more!
customer_reviews.text: We love it so much we bought two more! This is perfect for our 38.5 inch 3 year old. She steps up to the “big potty” on her own and also uses it at the sink to wash her hand and brush her teeth. This was very empowering for her. They are sturdy and blend in enough. Be aware, the color is a very pale blue/lilac and grey.
customer_reviews.author: Terri S Winbush

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler stool
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old can easily pick it up and move it to where she wants to go. She loves her stool! She brings it to help in the kitchen, to reach the sink to wash her hands and also to reach things I wish she wouldn’t!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Light weight useful handles on sides
customer_reviews.text: I saw something similar to this at target for half the price after u ordered it. But I kept this since it was already at our house. It definitely is light enough for my 2 year old grand daughter to move the steps to the bathroom counter so she can independently wash her hands. Always a good thing when in covid risk time.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great for reaching the sink
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, great for my kids, 4and 2 year old! This is the second one I buy, the first one my kids threw it around and it broke.
customer_reviews.author: denise luna

customer_reviews.title: Good stool
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2 year old. She can't quite reach the sink to was her hands yet just FYI for anyone getting this for small children. It is lightweight but very sturdy. She can carry it on her own and feels very stable when she stands / sits on it
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Little Helper
customer_reviews.text: Happy I purchased this. It gives the toddlers in my home daycare a boost & saves my back from picking them up to wash hands, etc.
customer_reviews.author: LeeLee

customer_reviews.title: Durable and High Quality Step Stool for my Cats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Step Stool for may cats Mishka and Pumpkin. My bed is little high and it was little difficult for them to jump in my bed. This Step Stool makes world of difference and I can tell my cats love it too. 😻
customer_reviews.author: John Baharoff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my 3 year old to stand on it to brush his teeth. I like that it’s two steps. It is sturdy and he hasn’t fallen off of it. I got the bumbo at first but it wasn’t high enough for him.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This product is for my 2.5 yr. old daughter who is eager for her Independence. The dual height 2 step stool made this happen for my sweet girl. She is able to wash her own hands, brush her teeth and turn the light on and off! She is very proud of herself and it allows her to feel she is able to do things on her own with success! I'm satisfied with my purchase! Looking forward to progressing to using the adult toilet with this product in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Treche' H.

customer_reviews.title: but in the end its fine.
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using this stool for for about a year now and he loves it as it lets him reach anywhere he needs to. Its a little more nerve wracking as a parent however as kids dont pay much attention and he did have one fall off the top step. If you are a paranoid parent id get a single step, but in the end its fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mukaking

customer_reviews.title: Top step too small; ineffective grips
customer_reviews.text: The height is good for toddlers, but the top step is small and narrow which can lead to falling off easily. Also, the bottom grips do not grip smooth surfaces. Unfortunately, it slipped right from under our toddler, resulting in an injury. I bought this one because I could not find the kind we already had that has a broader flat surface, grips on the steps, and effective grips on the underside.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: It is higher than most others you'll find at your local store and I like that it had handles and a bottom that gross ...
customer_reviews.text: The cabinets in our new home are quite high and I knew my kids would have trouble properly reaching the faucet. This stool really solved that issue. It is higher than most others you'll find at your local store and I like that it has handles and a bottom that grips to the floor to avoid slipping. I'm very happy with this cute stool.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Love this for potty training
customer_reviews.text: Kid is loving this stool. She instantly started using the big toilet instead of tiny carry one. Using for potty training, working on #2 is a challenge but she loves getting up there all by herself
customer_reviews.author: angela b

customer_reviews.title: Arrived today and we put it right into the bathroom ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today and we put it right into the bathroom. Step is not big enough for child to turn around to sit. The minute he tried to get down from the toilet (with my assistance) the stool toppled over. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best value for toddlers in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: I love the height and durability. I think the first step should be an inch longer due to shoes and slippers bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothea

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy and a good height
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and a good height. My daughter loves this step. It looks dingy quickly due to the non slip rubber on the top has grooves in it. It is fairly easy to wipe down. I like that it doesn't slide around on the tile floor. I feel safe for my tot to use this step by herself without my assistance at 2.5.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sproha

customer_reviews.title: Great little step stool
customer_reviews.text: Great little step stool. My 1.5year old uses it to reach the sink to brush her teeth. It’s tall and lightweight. Great size for her. We will start potty training soon and this is help her get up to the toilet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Elson

customer_reviews.title: Stools looks nice, I ordered two and one looks used and ...
customer_reviews.text: Stools looks nice, I ordered two and one looks used and was cracked. I started the return process and ordered another one...I'm sure it will work out fine. **********Update********* I forgot to update this after returning the stool that looked used. I received the other stool, they both look great and my kids love them. They’re able to reach the sink and wash their hands :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Twins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome step stool for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for both the toilet and the sink. We use it daily and have had no issues. I is lightweight so my daughter can carry it from toilet to sink. It is also durable and easy to clean. I like that the gray part has traction so she doesn’t slip.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Use it at the kitchen. Perfect for short girls
customer_reviews.text: I step on this to reach top shelves at the kitchen. I’m short and this product helps me reach items
customer_reviews.author: Amazonreviewer7777

customer_reviews.title: sturdy n safe
customer_reviews.text: perfect for different age levels. did not wrk for toilet but perfect for washing hands by basin. love it
customer_reviews.author: loke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product that is lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and is lightweight for easy handling. Even our toddler can lift and move the stool around. Despite not being very heavy, the stool is very sturdy. The rubber on the steps, the handles, and in the feet prevent the stool from sliding or moving. Our toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 2 year old. He needed help reaching the sink for hand washing and teeth brushing. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin K

customer_reviews.title: Great Stool
customer_reviews.text: The stool itself is a very sturdy and easy for our little one to pick up and move. It seems to be the perfect height for our toilet, but depending on how high your sink is it may be a little short. I would buy this again and have recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Artieri

customer_reviews.title: Good for toddler independence
customer_reviews.text: We keep this under the bathroom sink and it gives our 2yr old the independence to wash her hands herself. It has good grip and she doesn’t slip.
customer_reviews.author: JKQ

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This step stool worked so well for my toddler that I bought 2 more for bathrooms at work and then another just like it for our second bathroom at home. It's a great height for a 2 year old (supervised of course) and it doesn't slide at all. Love the grippiness of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, perfect height, and great value!
customer_reviews.text: These are great stools! Keep one in kitchen and one in bathroom for grandkids to wash up
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Cocherell

customer_reviews.title: Great for most things, a challenge for potty training
customer_reviews.text: It could be the height of my toliet seat, but it's a couple of inches too tall for my toddler to sit on the toliet with. Other than that, it's great to just stand up on to wash hands or stand next to me at the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Mia B

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and super easy for my 2.5 year old to move around as needed. Price can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Height.
customer_reviews.text: Love hate relationship. Yes, it's the perfect height for a 2 year old of average size to now reach the faucets very easily and have a wonderful time playing in the faucets....so buy door safety locks while you're at it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toddler step stool!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for my 20 month old to reach the sink in the bathroom. She loooovves to wash her hands and this saves my back! Great quality and easy enough for her to pick it up and move it around, too.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Parton

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. My toddler can use it to reach the sink on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product; and I write this review after 2 years using it with two kids
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: Very durable!
customer_reviews.text: These help my toddler so much with her independence and confidence! We use them for hand washing and also to get up on our tall bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Rothford

customer_reviews.title: 2 step stool
customer_reviews.text: This 2 step stool is perfect for use in my utility closet where I am now able to reach shelves so easily. It is very sturdy but also very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good stool for younger toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My son is only 16 months old, but tall for his age. I ordered another stool with only 1 step and it was too high for him to get on, but too low to reach the sink. The dual height step makes it possible for him to climb up himself. A good stool so far, though I do wish the top step were a little deeper and that the base was more weighted. It hasn't tipped over, but I think I would be more confident in the product if it felt heavier. Overall, a good purchase and he is thrilled he can reach the sink all by himself (and the water for splashing fun!)
customer_reviews.author: SEWilson

customer_reviews.title: The step stool is of great quality and we LOVE the handles and non-slip tread
customer_reviews.text: My two-year-old grandson carries this stool all around the house, using it for getting up on his big boy bed to washing his hands, to getting his toy off of the counter. He feels so "big" to be able to do these things by himself. The step stool is of great quality and we LOVE the handles and non-slip tread!!!
customer_reviews.author: TKLop

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Those steps are great for our 3 year old toddler. Easy for him to move and use anywhere
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Really good product.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for kids. I purchased this to donate to the local history museum for kids to use at the water fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Toddler approved
customer_reviews.text: Great step up, my boy has shorter legs so I find this helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Esteller

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old to help with using the sink (she's 36 inches). Sturdy, doesn't slide on the tile, and gives her enough height to look into the mirror (still can't reach the faucet).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these stick to the tile floor steps!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for potty time and handwashing Sticks great to the floor. Granddaughters are 2 & 4.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy so she can climb up and down without even ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses it to use the potty and to wash her hands afterward. It is very sturdy so she can climb up and down without even moving it. It is also light enough that she can pick it up on her own.
customer_reviews.author: themonkeys

customer_reviews.title: He can easily move it from in front of the toilet to ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the stool. He can easily move it from in front of the toilet to the sink to wash his hands. The only complaint is it's a little narrow and the top step could be deeper. My son has almost fallen off the stool trying to turn around to sit down.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Love the dual height
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my toddler. It’s her new best friend. She takes it everywhere around the kitchen, turning the lights off, washing her hands. Gives her a sense of independence. Very pleased with it. Its def better for having the dual height. Would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This broke the first time my daughter used it! Waste of money. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help my children have more independence in the bathroom. They love it and are always fighting over who gets to brush their teeth first
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie ula

product_meta.title: Dual Height 2 Step Stool for Kids | Slip Resistant Soft Grip Toddler's Stool for Potty Training and Use in The Bathroom or Kitchen | BPA Free for Comfort and Safety (Pack of 1, Gray White)
product_meta.description: Size:Pack of 1| Color:Gray WhiteGIVE YOUR CHILD INDEPENDENCE: They may be small, but toddlers are ready to take on the world! Give them the boost they need with our children’s step stool. From reaching the potty seat and brushing their teeth to helping out in the kitchen, kids will love being more independent. STYLISH, STURDY & VERSATILE : Young kids seem to grow faster than parents can keep up. But thanks to its dual height design, our step stool for toddlers accommodates different ages and heights! Made from lightweight plastic, and measuring 10.5" High x 13.5" Wide x 14" Deep, it’s easy to move yet can hold up to 396 lbs. GREAT FOR POTTY TRAINING: When used in conjunction with our matching toilet training seat, our step stool makes potty training a breeze! Made of the same materials and featuring a neutral gray and white color palette, this set fits seamlessly into any bathroom’s décor. REFINED SAFETY IN EVERY DETAIL: We care about the safety of your tot just as much as you do! That’s why our kids’ step stool features a slip-resistant design that provides a secure surface on all floor types. It also has soft-grip steps, giving little feet the comfort and support they need. 100% MONEY BACK WARRANTY - Secure Home by Jessa Leona uses only the highest quality materials. Our products are factory tested and we are confident you will absolutely love them. If you don’t, you are backed by our no questions asked, 90-day money back warranty!
feature_bullets: GIVE YOUR CHILD INDEPENDENCE: They may be small, but toddlers are ready to take on the world! Give them the boost they need with our children’s step stool. From reaching the potty seat and brushing their teeth to helping out in the kitchen, kids will love being more independent.

NON SLIP, SAFE, STURDY & VERSATILE: Young kids seem to grow faster than parents can keep up. But thanks to our dual height slip resistant design, this step stool for toddlers accommodates different ages and heights on all floor surfaces! Made from lightweight BPA free, PVC free, and environmentally friendly plastic, and measuring 10.3" High x 12.7" Wide x 14" Deep, it’s easy to move yet can hold up to 396 lbs. This versatile stool is portable, stackable and built to last.

PERFECT FOR POTTY TRAINING: When used in conjunction with our matching toilet training seat, our step stool makes potty training a breeze! Made of the same materials and featuring a neutral gray and white color palette, this set fits seamlessly into any bathroom’s décor

REFINED SAFETY IN EVERY DETAIL: We care about the safety of your tot just as much as you do! That’s why our kids’ step stool features a slip-resistant design that provides a secure surface on all floor types. It has soft-grip steps, giving little feet the comfort and support they need. We use BPA free, PVC free and environment friendly materials. Our stain resistant design is easy to wipe down and clean. Our stools are incredibly useful & stylish as well – and designed to match any house décor.
